awd_titl_txt: SGER:  Development of a Physically Meaningful Global Model  of the Critical Frequency of the F2 Layer of the Ionosphere
awd_abstract_narration: This is a Small Grant for Exploratory Research (SGER) to develop an innovative model to  predict the maximum electron density in the F region ionosphere.  The model is unique in that  it uses a set of planetary scale geomagnetic indices as input.  The dependence of F region  ionization on these indices provides important insight into the physical mechanisms that  determine ionospheric electron density.  In particular, preliminary results show that the intensity  of the ring current in the magnetosphere is crucial in accurately specifying the global electron  density.  This is evidence for a direct coupling mechanism between the solar wind and the  ionosphere.  This SGER will allow further refinement and development of the model including  validation and verification of the results by comparison with global electron density  measurements.  In the course of the study, the dependence of ionospheric conditions on various  driving forces will be identified and quantified.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
